column4: hi im on the phone trying to help my boss get some data from a tape drivre
cool! tape drives!
i know :/
you might want to try turning acpi off in the kernel boot options as that usually screws with PCI slots, but use that as a last resort
what kinda of PCI card is it? some sort of controller card?
its an adaptec raid card i think
can you see the raid card at all?
i think all its detecting is the onboard raid card
see it with this.. 'cat /proc/scsi/scsi'
k hold ill tell him
also, 'dmesg | grep st0' might show something useful
nothing on the dmesg or the cat
dang. sounds like the raid controller isnt getting seen at all. try another PCI slot, turn acpi off and boot again?
how do you turn acpci off?
select your kernel in grub, hit e, select the kernel line, hit e, add "acpi=off" and press b
do you think he'd benefit from trying this on a machine with native scsi support?
yes.
otherwise, you said it had onboard raid?
yes but i ithink its sata
bugger :)
say wha? hes super loyal to adaptec i think
well dont tell him that :)
gotcha ;)
ive got to go. sorry i couldnt help. good luck!
